abstract: Compared with current tax policy, the plan would also be likely to reduce federal tax revenues by $570 billion, or about 15 percent, according to the Tax Policy Center.
snippet: Compared with current tax policy, the plan would also be likely to reduce federal tax revenues by $570 billion, or about 15 percent, according to the Tax Policy Center.

headline.main: Rich Get Biggest Break in Perry Tax Plan, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Studying the Numbers On Perry’s Flat Tax
